body_html:
Hi, @cooltopics

Have you solved the problem?

I try to build a tensorflow user op under Window 10. Following the Official Docs, I successfully generate a zero_out.dll using VS2017, But when I try to load and use it in python,

import tensorflow as tf
zero_out_module = tf.load_op_library('./kernel/zero_out.dll')


use_cpu = True
device_count = {"GPU": 0} if use_cpu else {"GPU": 1}
with tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(device_count=device_count)):
  zero_out_module.zero_out([[1, 2], [3, 4]]).eval()

it produces an error with

AttributeError: module 'f21c708d1ddc75dcce283dd13fe531f7' has no attribute 'zero_out'

Do I miss something or make any mistakes? Do you have any suggestion?

Thanks a lot.

body:
Hi, @cooltopics 

Have you solved the problem?

I try to build a tensorflow user op under Window 10. Following the [Official Docs](https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op), I successfully generate a `zero_out.dll` using VS2017, But when I try to load and use it in python, 
```
import tensorflow as tf
zero_out_module = tf.load_op_library('./kernel/zero_out.dll')


use_cpu = True
device_count = {"GPU": 0} if use_cpu else {"GPU": 1}
with tf.Session(config=tf.ConfigProto(device_count=device_count)):
  zero_out_module.zero_out([[1, 2], [3, 4]]).eval()
```
it produces an error with 
```
AttributeError: module 'f21c708d1ddc75dcce283dd13fe531f7' has no attribute 'zero_out'
```

Do I miss something or make any mistakes? Do you have any suggestion?

Thanks a lot.
